name: Swimmimg
generalDescription: The coin is dedicated to the 28th Summer Olympic Games held in Athens (Greece) in 2004
averseDescription: On the coin obverse in the square there is depicted an allegoric scene of the opening of the Olympic Games: two female figures dressed in tunics are holding a cup with flame and laurel branches, the symbol of peace. Above the square there is engraved the small National Emblem of Ukraine and inscriptions: on the German silver coin - УКРАЇНА (Ukraine) (above), 2 ГРИВНІ (2/ Hryvnia/ 2002) (beneath). There is also the logotype of Mint of the National Bank of Ukraine.
reverseDescription: On the coin reverse in the square there is represented a full-face swimmer. Around the square there are the following inscriptions: ІГРИ/ XXVIII ОЛІМПІАДИ (Olympic Games) (above), OLYMPIC GAMES/ XXVIII (beneath), АФІНИ 2004 (to the left), ATHENS 2004 (on the right).
